bibl.title: Telegram from Vernon W. Lippard to Philip Showalter Hench, November 24, 1952

div1.p: Lippard, of the University of Virginia Medical School, requests that Hench make arrangements to place a wreath in memory of Virginia alumni Reed, Moran, and Kean at the Camp Lazear dedication.

div1.head: Telegram from Vernon W. Lippard to Philip Showalter Hench, November 24, 1952
div1.opener:
CLASS OF SERVICE
----
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
1201
(21)..
__________________________________________________
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MA259 RA331
R.CVA178 DL PD= CHARLOTTESVILLE VIR 24 344P=
1952 NOV 24 PM 3 36
DR. PHILIP S HENCH= MAYO CLINIC ROCHESTER MINN=
div1.p:
WOULD APPRECIATE YOUR MAKING ARRANGEMENTS PLACE ONE WREATH
IN MEMORY OF REED, MORAN AND KEAN AT CEREMONIES IN HAVANA
DECEMBER THIRD COLLEGE COLORS FOR RIBBONS BLUE AND ORANGE
PLEASE HAVE BILL SENT TO UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA SCHOOL OF
MEDICINE TO MY ATTENTION UNABLE TO FIND FACULTY MEMBER OR
ALUMNUS WHO CAN ATTEND SO ANY ARRANGEMENTS YOU MAKE WILL BE
SATISFACTORY THANKS FOR THINKING OF US=
div1.closer: VERNON W. LIPPARD= THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
